introduction: This video discusses algorithmic game theory, a field that focuses on research at the intersection of computer science, game theory, and economic theory. The speaker discusses three different lines of work in this area: government repacking of TV stations, efficient auction design, and computational mechanism analysis. The presentation also touches on the application of economic theory to development problems, specifically in building a cell phone-based mobile market for agricultural commodities in Uganda.

sections.title: Section 1: Introduction to Algorithmic Game Theory
content: Explanation of the concept of algorithmic game theory and its connection to computer science, game theory, and economic theory.
Mention of the famous book 'Algorithmic Game Theory' and its influence on the field.
Discussion on the focus of the talk, which is on three different lines of work in algorithmic game theory.
Overview of the three sections that will be covered in the talk.

sections.title: Section 2: Government Repacking of TV Stations
content: Description of the government repacking process and its purpose.
Explanation of how the government only has authority to repack certain TV stations due to legal restrictions.
Discussion on the potential impact of repacking on the stations involved and the viewers.
Mention of the example used to illustrate the concept: sponsored search auctions.

sections.title: Section 3: Efficient Auction Design
content: Explanation of the concept of auction design and its importance in economics.
Discussion on the simplicity of the problem of minimizing a parameter while keeping performance constant.
Introduction of the example used to illustrate the concept: stochastically dominating an algorithm.
Mention of the computational techniques used to find the exact equilibria of compactly represented games.

sections.title: Section 4: Computational Mechanism Analysis
content: Explanation of computational mechanism analysis and its purpose.
Discussion on the example used to illustrate the concept: finding the exact equilibria of compactly represented games.
Introduction of the technology used to find the exact equilibria: powerful techniques for finding exact equilibria of compactly represented games.
Mention of the potential applications of computational mechanism analysis in various fields.

sections.title: Section 5: Application of Economic Theory to Development Problems
content: Introduction to the application of economic theory to development problems.
Description of the example used to illustrate the concept: building a cell phone-based mobile market for agricultural commodities in Uganda.
Discussion on the challenges and opportunities presented by this application.
Mention of the potential impact of this application on the local community and the economy.
